name: CBA Studios
address: Los Angeles, CA (Specific address not publicly available)
description: A boutique Black-owned animation studio based in Los Angeles, specializing in 2D animation and known for its work with major clients like Disney, Apple TV, and John Legend

name: Studio Smokescreen
address: Los Angeles, CA (Specific address not publicly available)
description: A Los Angeles-based animation studio focused on mentoring and elevating marginalized and underrepresented talent, with experience working on projects for Disney, Dreamworks, and Netflix

name: Bwa Studios
description: A Black female-owned animation house that creates and produces programming and content for all platforms, with a focus on building equity in the animation industry by recruiting Black women, women of color, and nonbinary people of color

name: Reel Black Studios
description: A Black-owned creative animation studio run by a husband and wife duo, known for their short film "Burning Rubber."

name: Lion Forge Entertainment
address: St. Louis, MO (While not in California, it's a prominent Black-owned animation studio often mentioned in broader searches.)
description: An Academy Award-winning animation and live-action studio founded by David Steward II, committed to authentic storytelling and celebrating diverse voices. They have a partnership with Imagine Entertainment

name: Martian Blueberry
address: Los Angeles, CA (Specific address not publicly available)
description: An animation powerhouse co-founded by Love Barnett and animator Carl Jones, known for their work on "The Boondocks" and "Black Dynamite," aiming to create content that resonates with diverse communities

name: Magic Carpet Studios
description: Founded by Ferdy Adimefe, this studio is committed to transforming human consciousness by putting authentic African stories on the global entertainment map, expanding from 2D animation into games and 3D

name: Small Town Animation Studios
address: Southeast Georgia (Not in California, but mentioned as a Black-owned studio focusing on 3D CGI animation.)
description: Founded by Jermaine Hargrove, this Black-owned studio focuses on developing and producing 3D CGI feature film/TV animation for a global audience

name: Kugali
address: Not publicly available (Founded by individuals from different parts of Africa)
description: Known for innovation in animation, offering a unique blend of comic books, art, and augmented reality, with a vision to imagine the future of Africa through storytelling

name: Komotion Studios
address: Nigeria (Not in California, but mentioned for its 3D visualization and animation work, including the project "Dawn Of Thunder.")
description: A studio aiming to provide disruptive content and solutions, with expertise in design, 3D visualization, motion graphics, and animation
